snippet: The recent stop-and-frisk decision does nothing to disrupt the authority the Supreme Court has given police officers to target African-Americans and Latinos with little or no basis.
abstract: Op-Ed article by law Profs Devon W Carbado, Cheryl I Harris and Kimberle W Crenshaw contends decision that deemed New York Police Department's stop-and-frisk practice a violation of the Constitution does nothing to keep racial profiling from living on; holds court's interpretation gives police frighteningly wide discretion to continue to target minorities with little or no basis.

byline.original: By DEVON W. CARBADO, CHERYL I. HARRIS and KIMBERLE WILLIAMS CRENSHAW

lead_paragraph: The recent stop-and-frisk decision does nothing to disrupt the authority the Supreme Court has given police officers to target African-Americans and Latinos with little or no basis.
